column4: I've tried the compile help, I still cannot install this driver, I still do not know how
which driver?
it's a driver for my vistablet, xf86 input wacom 0.10.9
if I cant get my tablet working, I can't make money on my side art commissions
what is wrong with this driver?
I cannot install it, I do not know how, I even went through a compile help/tutorial thing
try sudo apt-get install xserver-xorg-input-wacom
I am not brave enough to compile an xorg driver... Just use the premade one.
pksadiq: there is no driver in the way smw told me to get it, and I have the tar.bz2 file I was only able to find
it should already be installed...
if it was already installed, my tablet would work properly
did you try the restricted drivers manager?
the what
system -> administration -> additional drivers
after you plug in the device of course.
actionparsnip: take note, my ubuntu computer has no internet until I get it to work, I am on my brother's computer and mine atm *goes with smw's suggestin first*
if you have no internet, how do you plan to install the drivers? lol
I cant use the disc that came with the adapter?
actionparsnip: it's not a card btw, it's a usb adapter
no, that is not possible
the disk was made for windows
so even if I were to go and get an actual wireless card, I would still need internet to get a driver so I can get on the internet?
unless the card has a driver installed in linux. Many cards work out of the box.
